15/*! \file */
16
17#include <config.h>
18
19#include <stddef.h>
20#include <inttypes.h>
21#include <stdlib.h>
22
23#include <isc/assertions.h>
24#include <isc/lfsr.h>
25#include <isc/util.h>
26
27#define VALID_LFSR(x) (x != NULL)
28
29void
30isc_lfsr_init(isc_lfsr_t *lfsr, uint32_t state, unsigned int bits,
31 uint32_t tap, unsigned int count,
32 isc_lfsrreseed_t reseed, void *arg)
33{
34 REQUIRE(VALID_LFSR(lfsr));
35 REQUIRE(8 <= bits && bits <= 32);
36 REQUIRE(tap != 0);
37
38 lfsr->state = state;
39 lfsr->bits = bits;
40 lfsr->tap = tap;
41 lfsr->count = count;
42 lfsr->reseed = reseed;
43 lfsr->arg = arg;
44
45 if (count == 0 && reseed != NULL)
46 reseed(lfsr, arg);
47 if (lfsr->state == 0)
48 lfsr->state = 0xffffffffU >> (32 - lfsr->bits);
49}
50
51/*!
52 * Return the next state of the lfsr.
53 */
54static inline uint32_t
55lfsr_generate(isc_lfsr_t *lfsr)
56{
57
58 /*
59 * If the previous state is zero, we must fill it with something
60 * here, or we will begin to generate an extremely predictable output.
61 *
62 * First, give the reseed function a crack at it. If the state is
63 * still 0, set it to all ones.
64 */
65 if (lfsr->state == 0) {
66 if (lfsr->reseed != NULL)
67 lfsr->reseed(lfsr, lfsr->arg);
68 if (lfsr->state == 0)
69 lfsr->state = 0xffffffffU >> (32 - lfsr->bits);
70 }
71
72 if (lfsr->state & 0x01) {
73 lfsr->state = (lfsr->state >> 1) ^ lfsr->tap;
74 return (1);
75 } else {
76 lfsr->state >>= 1;
77 return (0);
78 }
79}
80
81void
82isc_lfsr_generate(isc_lfsr_t *lfsr, void *data, unsigned int count)
83{
84 unsigned char *p;
85 unsigned int bit;
86 unsigned int byte;
87
88 REQUIRE(VALID_LFSR(lfsr));
89 REQUIRE(data != NULL);
90 REQUIRE(count > 0);
91
92 p = data;
93 byte = count;
94
95 while (byte--) {
96 *p = 0;
97 for (bit = 0; bit < 7; bit++) {
98 *p |= lfsr_generate(lfsr);
99 *p <<= 1;
100 }
101 *p |= lfsr_generate(lfsr);
102 p++;
103 }
104
105 if (lfsr->count != 0 && lfsr->reseed != NULL) {
106 if (lfsr->count <= count * 8)
107 lfsr->reseed(lfsr, lfsr->arg);
108 else
109 lfsr->count -= (count * 8);
110 }
111}
112
113static inline uint32_t
114lfsr_skipgenerate(isc_lfsr_t *lfsr, unsigned int skip)
115{
116 while (skip--)
117 (void)lfsr_generate(lfsr);
118
119 (void)lfsr_generate(lfsr);
120
121 return (lfsr->state);
122}
123
124/*
125 * Skip "skip" states in "lfsr".
126 */
127void
128isc_lfsr_skip(isc_lfsr_t *lfsr, unsigned int skip)
129{
130 REQUIRE(VALID_LFSR(lfsr));
131
132 while (skip--)
133 (void)lfsr_generate(lfsr);
134}
135
136/*
137 * Skip states in lfsr1 and lfsr2 using the other's current state.
138 * Return the final state of lfsr1 ^ lfsr2.
139 */
140uint32_t
141isc_lfsr_generate32(isc_lfsr_t *lfsr1, isc_lfsr_t *lfsr2)
142{
143 uint32_t state1, state2;
144 uint32_t skip1, skip2;
145
146 REQUIRE(VALID_LFSR(lfsr1));
147 REQUIRE(VALID_LFSR(lfsr2));
148
149 skip1 = lfsr1->state & 0x01;
150 skip2 = lfsr2->state & 0x01;
151
152 /* cross-skip. */
153 state1 = lfsr_skipgenerate(lfsr1, skip2);
154 state2 = lfsr_skipgenerate(lfsr2, skip1);
155
156 return (state1 ^ state2);
157}
